learning_objective: Translate between different bit representations of real-world phenomena, such as characters, numbers, and images.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex, the digital photography club president, wants to explain the concept of pixel representation to their club members. They choose an image of a rainbow to demonstrate how different colors are represented in binary. Alex extracts a single pixel's value which is the RGB (Red, Green, Blue) form: (12, 34, 56). Can you help Alex convert this pixel color to binary form?",
    "Answer1": "(00001100, 00100010, 111000)",
    "Answer2": "(1100, 100010, 111000)",
    "Answer3": "(00000011, 10000100, 00111000)",
    "Answer4": "(00001100, 00100010, 00111000)",
    "CorrectAnswer": "4",
    "Explanation": "Alex needs to convert the decimal values of Red (12), Green (34), and Blue (56) into their binary representation. To convert, they must use binary values up to 8 bits to ensure uniformity, hence the correct answers are 12 = 00001100, 34 = 00100010 and 56 = 00111000.",
    "code_snippet": "integer R = 12\ninteger G = 34\ninteger B = 56\noutput \"Red: \" + R.toBinaryString\noutput \"Green: \" + G.toBinaryString\noutput \"Blue: \" + B.toBinaryString"
}
